p: Forecasts for climate change in the UK suggest more frequent heat waves [ 73] and (with less certainty) increasing fluvial and pluvial flooding due to intense rainfall and river and surface runoff [ 74â€“ 77]. Higher sea levels are predicted, with more frequent coastal flooding [ 11, 78]. Cold wave risks are likely to reduce long term, but may continue in the shorter term, due to sea ice influences [ 79]. The speed of change in risk of climate impacts, as well as the level of risk, may be important for future capacity of local health services to cope with extreme weather. Areas of the country where the change in risk of heatwaves may be greatest up to 2030 are not necessarily those where the probability of heatwaves will be greatest [ 37].
